item.title: Sartana the Gravedigger
item.description: I am Sartana, Your Angel of Death is a 1969 Italian Western film directed by Giuliano Carnimeo and starring Gianni Garko. The film is presented on some DVD reissues under its German title, Sartana - Töten war sein täglich Brot.

item.title: Blood for a Silver Dollar
item.description: Blood for a Silver Dollar, also known as One Silver Dollar, is a 1965 Italian-French Spaghetti Western film directed by Giorgio Ferroni, written by Giorgio Stegani and Ferroni and starring Giuliano Gemma and Ida Galli.

item.title: The Last Traitor
item.description: The Last Traitor is a 1971 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Giuseppe Vari.

item.title: Adiós, Sabata
item.description: Adiós, Sabata is a 1970 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Gianfranco Parolini. It is the second film in The Sabata Trilogy by Parolini. Yul Brynner takes over the lead role from Lee Van Cleef, who stars in the first and third films.

item.title: Django Shoots First
item.description: Django Shoots First is an Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Alberto De Martino.

item.title: Seven Dollars on the Red
item.description: Sette dollari sul rosso is a 1966 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Alberto Cardone. It stars Anthony Steffen as the main character.

item.title: Long Days of Hate
item.description: Long Days of Hate is a 1968 Italian spaghetti western film directed by Gianfranco Baldanello.

item.title: Return of Shanghai Joe
item.description: Return of Shanghai Joe is a 1975 Western film directed by Bitto Albertini and starring Klaus Kinski.

item.title: Trinity Is Still My Name
item.description: Trinity Is Still My Name is a 1971 Italian Spaghetti Western comedy film directed by Enzo Barboni. Starring Terence Hill and Bud Spencer, it is a sequel to They Call Me Trinity (1970). It was shot extensively in Campo Imperatore, Abruzzo.
